intro: Oyedaea verbesinoides, commonly known as the African verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from blue to purple, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oyedaea verbesinoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
